topic: UNGA resolution on Venezuela - status and analysis
summary: Analysis of whether UNGA will adopt a resolution condemning US operation in Venezuela before Feb 1, 2026
content:
# Key Findings

## Timeline
- Jan 3: US military operation captures Maduro
- Jan 5: UNSC emergency meeting - broad condemnation
- Jan 7: UN experts urge member states to condemn
- Jan 9: Venezuela's envoy expressed regret to Guterres that UN had NOT yet condemned the action
- As of Jan 11: No evidence of UNGA resolution adopted or emergency special session called

## Historical Precedents
- Grenada (1983): Invasion Oct 25 → UNGA Resolution 38/7 Nov 2 (8 days)
- Panama (1989): Invasion Dec 20 → UNSC veto Dec 23 → UNGA Resolution 44/240 Dec 29 (9 days total)
- Iraq (2003): No UNGA condemnation resolution despite massive opposition
- Ukraine (2022): UNSC referral Feb 27 → UNGA resolution Mar 2 (3 days)

## Process Paths
1. UNSC draft → US veto → "Uniting for Peace" ESS → UNGA resolution
2. Regular UNGA session resolution

## Factors FOR resolution
- Strong historical precedent (Grenada, Panama)
- Overwhelming international condemnation including from allies
- Even France/UK critical (unlike Panama where they vetoed WITH US)
- NAM (120+ members) already condemned through Uganda
- Russia/China motivated to embarrass US
- UNGA President Baerbock critical
- UN Secretary-General critical
- 3 weeks remaining

## Factors AGAINST resolution
- No evidence of draft resolution as of Jan 9
- No UNSC veto yet (process hasn't started)
- Iraq 2003 precedent - no UNGA condemnation despite opposition
- US under Trump may pressure allies
- Venezuela lost voting rights (Article 19, arrears)
- Process slower than expected vs historical precedents
